### About Me

I am an industrial decarbonization [expert](https://www.linkedin.com/in/caitlin-swalec-75634972) and climate change advocate. I direct the Heavy Industry Program at [Global Energy Monitor](https://globalenergymonitor.org/), a nonprofit research organization, and teach graduate-level courses in [carbon accounting](https://bren.ucsb.edu/people/caitlin-swalec) at the University of California, Santa Barbara.Â I am also an experienced [open water swimmer](https://longswims.com/p/caitlin-swalec/) and [trail runner](https://ultrasignup.com/results_participant.aspx?fname=Caitlin&lname=Swalec&age=30), as well as a [fiber artist](https://www.instagram.com/glitterpathcrafts/).

### Current Position

**Program Director for Heavy Industry** \| Global Energy Monitor

-   Pitched and secured over \$1.75 million USD annually in funding for research initiatives in GEM's heavy industry program.

-   Managing a team of 10 project managers and researchers working to drive climate change action in the iron and steel, cement and concrete, and iron ore mining sectors.

-   Developed and launched datasets on global iron and steel production in order to support the industrial decarbonization movement.
